name: Homemade Chicken Noodle Soup
ingredients: 1 4-‐6 lb whole chicken, washed and cut into parts 1/4 tsp. coarse black pepper
3-‐4 celery stalks, washed well and diced 1/2 tsp each, bay leaf, sage, and thyme (﴾herbs tied in
1 onion, peeled and diced cheesecloth bag)﴿
2 carrots, washed and diced Water to cover about, about 6 cups
steps: In a large stockpot, combine all ingredients. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer, covered about 1 hour, or until chicken
is tender. Remove chicken from broth. Cool chicken just enough to hand, then remove meat from bones. Return skin
and bones to broth and continue simmering another hour. Meanwhile, cut chicken meat into bite-‐sized chunks and set
aside in refrigerator. When broth is finished simmering, strain through a fine sieve into plastic container. Cover and place
in refrigerator. When thoroughly cooled, remove solid fat from surface and discard.
Mix together completely. Add: 1 cup flour
Make into stiff dough. Roll dough in pasta machine or on floured board until very thin. If on board, let stand 20 minutes then
roll up loosely and slice into 1/4 inch strips. Unroll and let dry 2 hours. May be used immediately. If in pasta machine, attach
linguine cutter and slice to 1/4 inch and let dry 2 hours. May be used immediately.
Bring defatted chicken stock to boil Add fresh noodles and boil until al dente (﴾about 3 to 8 minutes depending on dryness)﴿.
Add chicken meat chunks and cook stirring gently until chicken is heated through. Makes 8 servings.
